purpleculture_pinyin:
jiǎo
to disturb; to annoy; to mix; to stir
беспокоить; раздражать; смешивать; размешать
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 搅)
Pictophonetic: 覺 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
攪拌 [ jiǎo bàn ]: to stir; to agitate
攪亂 [ jiǎo luàn ]: to disrupt; to throw into disorder
攪動 [ jiǎo dòng ]: to mix; to stir
攪和 [ jiǎo huo ]: to mix; to blend; (fig.) to spoil; to mess up things; to run around with (sb); to get involved with; to mix (with other people)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 覺 [ jué ] conscious; to nap, to sleep; to wake up
heisig_chinese_memo: You stir the cake mix for a while, but need to test the texture with your sense of touch, your fingers, before sticking it in the oven.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: I finally came to my senses when I decided to use my fingers to stir the cake mix with a wooden spoon instead of a little metal one.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " hand ", the sound of " feeling " means disturbing and disturbing. "Said Wen": "Chaos. From the hand, feel the sound. "Poetry" said: Only disturb my heart." "Poetry·Xiaoya·He Rensi": "When I die, I only disturb my heart." : "Disturbing, chaos."

" Stirring " can mean stirring and stirring. Jin Zhanghua's "Natural History" Volume 4: "Fried sesame oil, the water vapor is exhausted, there is no smoke and does not reboil, but it is still cold, and you can stir it with your own hands."

" Chu " in modern Chinese also means mischief and teasing. "The Heroes of the Sons and Daughters" Chapter 2: "Why did this master give this? He was still a riverman giving gifts, or was it the funeral of the grave? Isn't this a disturbance!"
humanum_short_description_en: From the " hand ", the sound of " feeling " means disturbing and disturbing.
humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「覺」聲，表示擾亂、打擾。《說文》：「亂也。从手，覺聲。《詩》曰：祇攪我心。」《詩‧小雅‧何人斯》：「胡逝我梁，祇攪我心。」毛傳：「攪，亂也。」

　　「攪」可表示攪拌、攪動。晉張華《博物志》卷四：「煎麻油，水氣盡，無煙不復沸，則還冷，可內手攪之。」

　　「攪」在近代漢語中也表示胡鬧、戲弄。《兒女英雄傳》第2回：「怎麼這位爺送起這個來了？他還是河員送禮，還是看墳的打抽豐來了？這不是攪嗎！」
humanum_short_description: 從「手」，「覺」聲，表示擾亂、打擾。

攪和 [ jiǎo huo ]: to mix; to blend; (fig.) to spoil; to mess up things; to run around with (sb); to get involved with; to mix (with other people)

(Simplified: 搅)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 覺 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
HSK: 6
Chinese: You stir the cake mix for a while, but need to test the texture with your sense of touch, your fingers, before sticking it in the oven.
Meaning: stir
Hanzi: 搅
Story: I finally came to my senses when I decided to use my fingers to stir the cake mix with a wooden spoon instead of a little metal one.
Kind: traditional

從「 手 」，「 覺 」聲，表示擾亂、打擾。《說文》：「亂也。从手，覺聲。《詩》曰：祇攪我心。」《詩‧小雅‧何人斯》：「胡逝我梁，祇攪我心。」毛傳：「攪，亂也。」 「 攪 」可表示攪拌、攪動。晉張華《博物志》卷四：「煎麻油，水氣盡，無煙不復沸，則還冷，可內手攪之。」 「 攪 」在近代漢語中也表示胡鬧、戲弄。《兒女英雄傳》第2回：「怎麼這位爺送起這個來了？他還是河員送禮，還是看墳的打抽豐來了？這不是攪嗎！」
From the " hand", the sound of " feeling" means disturbing and disturbing. "Said Wen": "Chaos. From the hand, feel the sound. "Poetry" said: Only disturb my heart." "Poetry·Xiaoya·He Rensi": "When I die, I only disturb my heart." : "Disturbing, chaos." " Stirring" can mean stirring and stirring. Jin Zhanghua's "Natural History" Volume 4: "Fried sesame oil, the water vapor is exhausted, there is no smoke and does not reboil, but it is still cold, and you can stir it with your own hands." " Chu" in modern Chinese also means mischief and teasing. "The Heroes of the Sons and Daughters" Chapter 2: "Why did this master give this? He was still a riverman giving gifts, or was it the funeral of the grave? Isn't this a disturbance!"

攪字的基本解释

攪
jiǎo
见“搅”。

攪字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jiǎo］
［《廣韻》古巧切，上巧，見。］
亦作“捁1”。“撹1”的繁体字。“搅1”的繁体字。
(1)搅拌；搅动。
(2)扰乱，打扰。
(3)缠绕。
(4)胡闹；戏弄。
(5)搞；弄。
(6)治，治理。

攪字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　攪； 康熙笔画：24； 页码：页465第01
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?古巧切，音絞。【說文】亂也。【增韻】撓也。【詩·小雅】祇攪我心。又【廣韻】手動也。【方岳詩】搜攪平生書五車。或作捁。又【集韻】下巧切。同㩭。見㩭字註。

攪字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
攪字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jiǎo］
["Guangyun" Gu Qiao cut, Shang Qiao, see you. ]
Also known as "捁1". "撹1" in traditional characters. Traditional Chinese characters for "Mi 1".
(1) Stir; stir.
(2) Disturb, disturb.
(3) Winding.
(4) Mischief; teasing.
(5) Engage; get.
(6) Governance, governance.

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Mao Ji] [Hand Character Department] 　chu; Kangxi Strokes: 24; Page Number: Page 465 No. 01
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? Ancient Qiao cut, sound twisted. [Said Wen] Chaos too. [Zeng Yun] Nao Ye. [Poetry Xiaoya] It only disturbs my heart. Also [Guangyun] Manually. [Fang Yueshi] Search for five carts of life books. Or as a trance. Also 【Jiyun】Cut ingeniously. Same as 㩭. See 㩭 word note.
